@dh7net This was made using CelebA dataset running on a lightly modified version of @dumoulinv's discgen project. https://t.co/xQtRbIiQDN
@ogrisel @liorshkiller @dumoulinv Each is a tiny patch of latent space. CelebA is biased, but my curation/cherry-piâ€¦ https://t.co/Jcu623B9AY
@ogrisel @liorshkiller @dumoulinv Goal: highlight the conceptual space built by the model. Yes, at best representative of the training data.
@porestar @fchollet @ogrisel With too few dimensions the model underfits and there won't be sufficient variety / distinctions in outputs.
@liorshkiller This uses CelebA dataset running on a tweaked version of @dumoulinv's discgen model: https://t.co/xQtRbIiQDN
@EldinhoC @Omair28Khan Not really: currently the SR step isn't making a huge difference. Here's the same grid straiâ€¦ https://t.co/CABYJQOWEY
@Omair28Khan Thanks, still refining. for the record: this is a VAE reconstruction MINE grid + a thin schmear of advâ€¦ https://t.co/pHSP4EZP1V
@porestar Certainly a great idea. At this stage the scale variation is arbitrary.
@fchollet @ogrisel Just trial and error. In general, I dial down the latent space dimension until I can see reconstructions suffer.
@ogrisel No quantitative checks - but I don't think it is. Latent space is small (160 dim) and OOS reconstructions/interpolations look good.
@alexjc Thanks. Tweaked my CelebA based dataset and training a new model. The image I posted is cherry-picked.
